title: Linux atq Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the atq command in Linux, which allows you to list and manage scheduled jobs. Learn how to view, remove, and work with cron jobs effectively.

meta.title: Linux atq Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the atq command in Linux, which allows you to list and manage scheduled jobs. Learn how to view, remove, and work with cron jobs effectively.
meta.keywords: Linux, atq, atrm, cron, job scheduling, process management

verify.name: Verify atq command
verify.hint: The `atq` command should display at least one scheduled job for the 'labex' user.

verify.name: Verify scheduled jobs
verify.hint: The `atq` command should display at least one scheduled job for the 'labex' user.

verify.name: Verify scheduled jobs removed
verify.hint: The `atq` command should not display any scheduled jobs for the 'labex' user.
